CatDescriptText: Mr. Curtis Tucker, store clerk, 240 Madison Avenue, was part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, November 7, 1959, pg. A1 with question: "Do you think that Negroes should push for non-segregated cemeteries, or should they sponsor their own?"  Answer reads: "I don't think that we should build our won. We are all the same, so therefore, we should be placed in the same cemeteries and have the same rights.  I don't believe in any form of segregation or discrimination."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Curtis Tucker wearing light colored zippered pullover and square patterned shirt, standing outdoors
